attributes.action: stop the Home Office from interfering in the negotiation of police pay
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since 1979, the police have had an effective and fair means of negotiating their pay through the Edmund-Davies formula.  This recognised the unique status of police officers and their inability to take industrial action to secure fair pay deals.  The Home Office are now seeking to undermine this agreement and create distrubance and unrest in the police service.
